imdb.title: Jinsei
imdb.plot: When bespectacled Yuki Akamatsu joins his school's 2nd Newspaper Club, he finds himself caught in the crossfire between three pretty panelists assigned to the Life Advice column.

episodes.title: Counseling
episodes.plot: Yuki Akamatsu is assigned to manage the "Life Advice" column of his high school's second newspaper club. He meets his three expert panelists, Rino (Sciences), Fumi (Humanities), and Ikumi (Athletics), and together, they field questions from the students.

episodes.title: Reflections
episodes.plot: The panel fields questions about a fortune-telling that is anything but fortunate, how to reconcile with a best friend after a big fight, what to do when a friend becomes more popular, and etiquette when it comes to buying birthday gifts for a friend.

episodes.title: Capital
episodes.plot: While responding to a boy who lacks self-confidence, the panel cheers on Rino as she learns to ride a bike. The 1st Newspaper Club president sets out to sabotage the 2nd Newspaper Club with a copycat column. Fumi stands up to her overbearing grandfather.

episodes.title: Summer Things
episodes.plot: The newspaper staff goes on their summer retreat at a rental house overlooking the beach. Questions include how to stop being so forgetful, how to tell if one's signals are mixed, and one from Asano, rubbing in how much better his club's retreat will be.

episodes.title: Short
episodes.plot: It's the day of the big showdown between the 1st and 2nd Newspaper Clubs, and Asano is letting the home viewers vote to decide which contestant wins each round. However, not everything is on the up-and-up. Later, the panelists field a bonus question.

episodes.title: Iida
episodes.plot: Someone sets fire to the advice column's submission box! The hunt is on to discover the culprit behind this crime, and Ikumi knows just the person they need to come to their rescue! Meanwhile, the panel answers other questions they find around town.

episodes.title: Beautiful Voice
episodes.plot: In an effort to get Mr. Iida, the man behind Koganen, to help them deal with the suggestion box vandalism, the panel creates a list of conversation starters for him to use with women. But Iida is ready to pass the torch on to a new generation of hero.

episodes.title: Word Chain
episodes.plot:

episodes.title: Rejected
episodes.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

episodes.title: Negative
episodes.plot: Student Council President Kaori blocks the 2nd Newspaper Club members from participating in the school culture festival unless the advice column panel can turn around three of the worst negative-attitude problem cases at the school.

episodes.title: Application
episodes.plot: Ayaka believes she finally has the means to overthrow Kaori, but it will require entering Ikumi into the school's beauty pageant. The panel answers questions about strengthening friendships by sharing secrets, and placing one's trust in other people.

episodes.title: Infiltration
episodes.plot: The club members put together Ikumi's beauty pageant promotional video. Ikumi sneaks into Kaori's office to find evidence, but all does not go as planned. The panelists tackle how to avoid physical conflicts and not being afraid to assert one's opinions.

episodes.title: Komohatake
episodes.plot: Ayaka comes up with a plan to expose Kaori's crooked beauty pageant by having Ikumi throw the contest, but not to be outdone, Kaori has a plan of her own. The column is asked about going along to get along when dealing with superiors.
